td.content: s:31 year old white m tutor presents with mild dizziness since hitting the front of the head 2 days ago. he also reports mild blurred vision, moderate nausea, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the mild dizziness. he had no LOC o:Height 68 in, Weight 166 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 15, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, NAD, Neck = supple w/o TTP, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL w/ no deficits, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Psych = Mood, affect NL, appropriate judgement a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:31 year old white m returns for f/u approx. one (1) week s/p concussion. denies blurred vision, nausea and dizziness. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. o:Height 69 in, Weight 171 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, HEENT = NCAT, PERRL, C/V = RRR, Abd = Soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Neck = Supple, Pulm = CTAB. Good respiratory effort, MS = Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with no loss of consciousness). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

No deficits , Neck = Supple , Pulm = CTAB
